reviewText: This review is for the Blu-ray set.  When I first saw these two movies in the cinema years agoI was quite blown away.  I decided to replace my VHS copies (finally) and saw this double BD set.  I was very happy to see that Echo Bridge had not gotten their hands on these two films.  The video transfer is excellent, though the audio is a bit lacking in dynamic range.  There are no extras, either.  Still, all in all, a great buy.

reviewText: These are two great Horror movies and I enjoy watching them however there are no Commentary tracks on this DVD. I know it's probably not a big deal to most buyers But I really like having the commentaries,That's why I give this a 4 star instead of a 5 star.If you don't give a crap about Commentary or special features than you won't care at all. This a very good quality DVD and it looks great on my 1080p tv

reviewText: These are truly genuine horror films that have raised the horrific bar in the genre. The second is a continuation of the first with some closure to it that doesn't obviously lead to a third in the franchise. Makes the double feature containing both appropriate. Blu-ray transfers are very good, both picture and audio, but the disks are bare-bones with English audio (no other dubbed languages), no subtitles, and very little for extras beyond trailers. Got the 4th and 5th Hellraiser movies as part of a bundle and they're nowhere near the first two in suspense or horror. Don't know at this point if I'm going to pursue the 3rd one or not and may just stop with the first two as apparently a number of others have done.
summary: Much Better Than The Sequels That Follow - Blu-ray Transfer Good, but Bare-Bones
Title: N/A

reviewText: Clive Barker is definitely an acquired taste.  If you love his work this is a "must" for your collection.I am not going to do an in depth review as there are too many of these around as it is!In my humble opinion, this is definitely one of the most disturbing horror movie franchises. Clive Barker certainly has a unique perspective on this genre. (Watch "The Midnight Meat Train" if you don't believe me!)Overall, one of the best true horror movies around.If you are wondering why I did not give this 5 stars the answer is quite simple... I reserve that rating for really great movies. Last 5 star rating I gave was for Lord of the Rings (extended versions).
summary: You will love it or hate it!

reviewText: With me, the first one truly ranks as one of the creepiest films ever produced. This is a movie in the genre of "The Exorcist" in that it stands alone in the way it being a different way to present terror.This isn't to say the two are anything alike, only they presented horror in new ways. The whole movie seems hell-bent on making you as uncomfortable as it can and with me, at least, succeeds. The character of Frank is as evil a person as has ever been depicted in a film, but his "reward" at the end is so horrific that it says with me to this day. The second movie is a bit of a let-down but still far more effective than any of the slapped together, poor attempts to stretch the franchise basing it on the Cenobite commonly referred to as "Pin Head". But this package is a good buy as you get enough of the story to be satisfied with without having to get involved with any of the other movies of the franchise.
Title: N/A
